result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ARNOLD T WHIRRY

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ARNOLD T WHIRRY in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant if he is getting an attorney. Statement by the defendant - has contacted attorneys and has received retainer fee amounts. Court questions defendant if he has filled out the form for court appointed counsel. Statement by the defendant. Statement by the Court - informs defendant he just needs a pay stub. Court instructs the defendant that he is to bring everything to the next court date. Court sets for Status of Counsel on November 29, 2022 at 2:45 PM.
Second appearance scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Second appearance on November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:25 AM Defendant ARNOLD T WHIRRY in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he's attempted to get an attorney and filled out the form for court appointed counsel. Defendant requests more time to obtain counsel. Second of Counsel set for November 1, 2022 at 2:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:26 AM
Second appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Second appearance on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ARNOLD T WHIRRY in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he does not qualify for a public defender and has not been able to find an attorney so far due to fixed income. Further statement by defendant, he has not yet completed the petition for court appointed attorney. Court sets for Second Appearance on September 13, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant ARNOLD T WHIRRY in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Statement by defendant - may be requesting court appointed counsel as he is a disabled veteran.

Court adjourned at 9:42 AM
Second appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD:

Defendant appears via video, in custody with Atty Michael Kapelis, also by video. Matt McElroy for the State of Wisconsin, via video. Court questions defendant regarding address and employment. ADA makes bond request. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court sets for initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 9:30 a.m.
